com.stormpath.shiro.client

Class ClientFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.shiro.util.AbstractFactory<com.stormpath.sdk.client.Client>
      • com.stormpath.shiro.client.ClientFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.shiro.util.Factory<com.stormpath.sdk.client.Client>

    public class ClientFactory
extends org.apache.shiro.util.AbstractFactory<com.stormpath.sdk.client.Client>
    A simple bridge component that allows a Stormpath SDK Client to be created via Shiro's Factory concept.

    As this class is a simple bridge between APIs, it does not do much - all configuration properties are immediately passed through to an internal ClientBuilder instance, and the createInstance() implementation merely calls ClientBuilder.build().

    Usage
    Example shiro.ini configuration: 

     [main]
 ...
 cacheManager = some.impl.of.org.apache.shiro.cache.CacheManager
 securityManager.cacheManager = $cacheManager

 stormpathClient = com.stormpath.shiro.client.ClientFactory
 stormpathClient.apiKeyFileLocation = /home/myhomedir/.stormpath/apiKey.properties
 stormpathClient.cacheManager = $cacheManager

 stormpathRealm = com.stormpath.shiro.realm.ApplicationRealm
 stormpathRealm.client = $stormpathClient
 stormpathRealm.applicationRestUrl = https://api.stormpath.com/v1/applications/yourAppIdHere

 securityManager.realm = $stormpathRealm

 ...
    Since:
    0.1
    See Also:
    ClientBuilder, ClientBuilder.setApiKey(com.stormpath.sdk.api.ApiKey), ApiKeyBuilder.setFileLocation(String)

        public void setApiKeyFileLocation(String apiKeyFileLocation)
        Calls clientBuilder.setApiKey(ApiKeys.builder().setFileLocation(apiKeyFileLocation).build()). See that JavaDoc for expected syntax/format.
        Parameters:
        apiKeyFileLocation - the file, classpath or url location of the API Key .properties file to load when constructing the API Key to use for communicating with the Stormpath REST API.
        Since:
        0.2
        See Also:

      • setCacheManager

        public void setCacheManager(org.apache.shiro.cache.CacheManager cacheManager)
        Uses the specified Shiro CacheManager instance as the Stormpath SDK Client's CacheManager, allowing both Shiro and Stormpath SDK to share the same cache mechanism.

        If for some reason you don't want to share the same cache mechanism, you can explicitly set a Stormpath SDK-only CacheManager instance via the setStormpathCacheManager method.

        Parameters:
        cacheManager - the Shiro CacheManager to use for the Stormpath SDK Client's caching needs.
        Since:
        0.4.0
        See Also:
        setStormpathCacheManager(com.stormpath.sdk.cache.CacheManager)

      • setStormpathCacheManager

        public void setStormpathCacheManager(com.stormpath.sdk.cache.CacheManager cacheManager)
        Calls clientBuilder.setCacheManager using the specified Stormpath CacheManager instance, but note: This method should only be used if the Stormpath SDK should use a different CacheManager than what Shiro uses.

        If you prefer that Shiro and the Stormpath SDK use the same cache mechanism to reduce complexity/configuration, configure your preferred Shiro cacheManager first and then use that cacheManager by calling the setCacheManager(shiroCacheManager) method instead of this one.

        Parameters:
        cacheManager - the Storpmath SDK-specific CacheManager to use for the Stormpath SDK Client's caching needs.
        Since:
        0.4.0
        See Also:
        setCacheManager(org.apache.shiro.cache.CacheManager)
